data.title: Fix gd::String::From/ToLocale crashing on some Linux distro
data.body: (on which the UTF8 locale is named utf8 and not utf-8, like Fedora 23 !)

data.title: OR not selecting all object's instances if the true subcondition is not related to the object
data.body:
As said in http://forum.compilgames.net/viewtopic.php?f=20&t=7449, the OR condition has some defects.

Consider an event with an OR condition with one of its subcondition related to an object and another not. If the event is executed because of the second one (and the first one is false for all instances of the object), none of the object instances are selected and the actions related to this object will not act on any of the instances. 

**This should not be the case : as the event is executed because of the second condition, the list of object's instance should not be restricted and the action should act an all instances.**

I attached an example : In the "ORCondition" scene, if the variable everything is = 1, all instance of TextObject should be set to "TRUE" but its not the case.

[AdvancedConditionsBugs.gdg.zip](https://github.com/4ian/GD/files/93087/AdvancedConditionsBugs.gdg.zip)

data.title: Fix server serving a invalid directory on some libstdc++ impl. [mongoose version]
data.body: Fix #212 but on master when mongoose.

data.title: Fix HttpServer not using a valid path on some libstdc++ implementations
Consider integrating/extending an existing  game engine in GDevelop?
data.body:
What are your thoughts regarding integrating and extending an existing game engine in GDevelop? Some examples could include:
- [Kiwi.js](http://www.kiwijs.org/) - has entity/component system, canvas/WebGL rendering, plugins, animation, touch input, audio, etc
- [Cocos2d-x](http://www.cocos2d-x.org/) - extensive features inluding audio, sprites, scenes, events, physics, actions, multi-platform support, scripting (C++, JavaScript, and Lua), etc

In effect, building on an existing game engine, with established community, could save a lot of time by allowing GDevelop to use a higher level framework.

data.title: Changed SetBestSize to SetInitialSize.
data.body: This prevents a wxWidgets deprecated warning.

data.title: String warning fixes
data.body: These changes removed many gcc 4.9.2 warnings from a Fedora 21 build.

data.title: b2TOISolver initialization fix
data.body:
A non-pointer data member (int32 m_count), was incorrectly being initialized to NULL instead of 0 and gcc 4.9.2 was pointing this out:

```
[ 83%] Building CXX object Extensions/PhysicsBehavior/CMakeFiles/PhysicsBehavior.dir/Box2D/Box2D/Box2D/Dynamics/Contacts/b2TOISolver.cpp.o
/home/pstieber/OutsideSource/gdevelop/GD/Extensions/PhysicsBehavior/Box2D/Box2D/Box2D/Dynamics/Contacts/b2TOISolver.cpp: In constructor ‘b2TOISolver::b2TOISolver(b2StackAllocator*)’:
/home/pstieber/OutsideSource/gdevelop/GD/Extensions/PhysicsBehavior/Box2D/Box2D/Box2D/Dynamics/Contacts/b2TOISolver.cpp:41:10: warning: converting to non-pointer type ‘int32 {aka int}’ from NULL [-Wconversion-null]
  m_count = NULL;
          ^
```

This commit removed the warning.

data.title: Update wx font styles
data.body: This removed 49 warnings from my Fedora 21 build with gcc.

data.title: Updated wxBrush styles.
data.body:
Changed the following in wxBrush constructors:
wxTRANSPARENT -> wxBRUSHSTYLE_TRANSPARENT
wxSOLID -> wxBRUSHSTYLE_SOLID
wxFDIAGONAL_HATCH -> wxBRUSHSTYLE_FDIAGONAL_HATCH
This fixed 6 warnings in the build.

data.title: wxTextCtrl and and wxMenuItem updates
data.body: While attempting to build gdevelop on Fedora 21 using GCC 4.9.2 against a current wxWidgets master built with 2.8 compatibility turned off, I ran into a few compilation errors that were fixed with these changes.

data.title: Change sign test text to conventional terms
data.body:
The terms in the sign test files were slightly peculiar. I have changed them to match more conventional terms, as referenced below. The changes are as such:
- 'lesser than' -> 'less than'
- 'different of' -> 'not equal to'
# References

These references are simply intended to demonstrate common usage and terminology relating to the '>', '<', and '!=' symbols.
- Wikipedia: 
  - [Inequality (mathematics)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Inequality_%28mathematics%29)
  - [Less-than sign](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Less-than_sign)
  - [Relational operator - standard relational operators](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Relational_operator#Standard_relational_operators)
- Khan Academy [Greater-than and less-than symbols](https://www.khanacademy.org/math/pre-algebra/applying-math-reasoning-topic/greater-than-less-than/v/greater-than-and-less-than-symbols)
- Mozilla Developer Network: [Less than operator](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Operators/Comparison_Operators#Less_than_operator_%28%3C%29)

data.title: Error when starting GDevelop as non priveleged user
data.body:
On a fresh installation of GDevelop, I get an error on startup:

```
Error when loading:

... 
May be a missing file or permissions issue.
```

The error is paraphrased, and disappears when launching GDevelop with `sudo` permissions.

data.title: Add version number to GDevelop interface
data.body:
```
As a bug reporter
I would like to quickly find my GDevelop version
so that I can provide that information with my issue reports
```
# Observed bahavior

It is not easy to determine the GDevelop version number, either from the help menu or the starting screen.
# Expected behavior

The version number would be printed on the help menu, start screen, or some similar location.

data.title: Cannot drag and drop on Ubuntu 15.10
data.body:
There are several usability issues with the user flow for adding an image sprite object. For a new user, the steps could be more intuitive and direct.
# Observed behavior

On the _Edit the sprite object_ window, dragging an image from the _Images selector_ to the _checkered canvas_ has no effect.
# Steps to reproduce
1. Create new HTML5 project
2. Click **Images bank** tab
   1. Double click **images** in project manager (note, clicking the _Images bank_ tab does not open the Images bank window)
3. click **Add an image**
4. select a .png image
5. double click a scene in the _Scenes_ section
6. Right click **Objects** in _Objects' editor_
7. click **Add an object**
8. double click new object
9. drag the PNG file from the **Image bank's editor** to the checkered canvas
# Expected behavior

Dragging elements from the sidebar to the main area would cause the element to appear in the main area.
# Environment

Ubuntu 15.10
GDevelop version 4.0.87.0

data.title: Firefox already running error when launching HTML5 game
data.body:
# Observed behavior

When clicking _Preview_, on Ubuntu 15.10, I get the following error:

```
Firefox is already running, but is not responding. To open a new window, you must first close the existing Firefox process, or restart your system.
```
# Expected behavior

The game preview would open in the existing Firefox process, but in a new tab.

data.title: Add support for rebranding
Use std::vector<std::pair<gd::String, gd::PropertyDescriptor>> for gd::Object::GetProperties and GetInstanceProperties
data.body: The use of std::map forces the properties to be sorted in the alphabetic order (that can vary depending on the language). The use of `std::vector<std::pair<...>>` could solve the problem and lets GDevelop and extensions order the properties the way they want (in the insertion order)

data.body: When building a native game with no scenes open, it works again.

data.title: Audio resources
data.body:
The resource editor can now have audio resources. 
Actions to play sounds/musics are now able to take either the path of the audio file, as before, or the name of the resource.
`SoundManager` was refactored to be owned by RuntimeGame (a bit like ImageManager) (both in HTML5 and native games).

Having audio files as resources allow HTML5 games to preload the sounds.

@victorlevasseur You could be interested by this :)

data.title: Can't set up execution engine on game within folders with accentuated letters
data.body: Seems that the compiled game can't find the Code.dll when the folder contains accentuated letters (on Windows only). Strange, why does GDevelop use the full path to load Code.dll ?

data.title: Import TMX files (Tiled Editor) into TileMap Objects
data.body:
**(not ready to merge, need testing)**

Add the possibility to import .tmx file into a Tilemap object. These files are the files saved by the Tiled tilemap editor, a very popular tilemap free editor. The goal is to be able to import the tileset (image and configuration), the tilemap and the hitboxes. Only orthogonal tilemaps are supported (obviously).

**Library used :**
It uses tmxparser (https://github.com/andrewrk/tmxparser), an opensource parser using TinyXML2 (both embedded in the extension).

**What is done :**
- [X] Import the tileset configuration (except the image) : supports spacing and tilesize, not margins currently (as the extension doesn't support it)
- [x] Import the tileset image : done in 33ff926, imports the image as imported<NUMBER>_<FILENAME>.<EXTENSION> and set this resources as the tileset image.
- [X] Import the tilemap : the 3 first tile layers are imported into the 3 layers of the object
- [X] Import the hitboxes : supports only one hitbox per tile, only a rectangle or a polygon

These features need testing.

Note : the hitboxes are imported from tile's objects (tiles' objects can be edited in View > Tile collision editor)
